newsitem.title: ABU DHABI: Abu Dhabi approves $136 mln in new housing loans.
newsitem.headline: Abu Dhabi approves $136 mln in new housing loans.

text.p: Abu Dhabi on Tuesday approved 500 million dirhams ($136 million) in new interest-free housing loans for 569 citizens of the United Arab Emirates' state.
The official WAM news agency said the loans will help finance the building of new homes as well as upgrading and expanding existing ones in Abu Dhabi.

An Abu Dhabi official told Reuters each applicant, mostly middle class Abu Dhabi citizens, can receive a maximum housing loan of 900,000 dirhams payable over 25 years. The state also gives them a plot of land free of charge.
Abu Dhabi, the richest of the seven UAE emirates which controls most of the country's oil-weath, builds and grants homes to citizens with low incomes at a cost of between 450,000 and 750,000 dirhams.
